docs.abstract: The electric carmaker has reduced prices by thousands of dollars this year to bolster demand and fend off competition.
docs.snippet: The electric carmaker has reduced prices by thousands of dollars this year to bolster demand and fend off competition.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tesla’s profit fell sharply in the first three months of the year after it cut the prices of its electric vehicles, the company said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Tesla’s Profit Dropped Sharply in First Quarter as It Cut Prices
headline.print_headline: Tesla’s Quarterly Profit Drops After a Series of Price Cuts

byline.original: By Peter Eavis and Jack Ewing

docs.abstract: Buying an electric car has become much more complicated because of restrictions on which models qualify for a federal tax credit of up to $7,500.
docs.snippet: Buying an electric car has become much more complicated because of restrictions on which models qualify for a federal tax credit of up to $7,500.
docs.lead_paragraph: Designed to accelerate the shift to electric cars among other climate goals, the Inflation Reduction Act has in practice made buying such vehicles a lot more complicated.

headline.main: Electric Vehicle Tax Credit Rules Create ‘Chaos for Consumers’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks

docs.abstract: Rules that take effect on Tuesday will limit the $7,500 credits to electric cars made domestically with minerals from the U.S. or trade allies.
docs.snippet: Rules that take effect on Tuesday will limit the $7,500 credits to electric cars made domestically with minerals from the U.S. or trade allies.
docs.lead_paragraph: American brands like Tesla and General Motors will benefit most from rules that determine which electric vehicles qualify for tax credits starting on Tuesday. Foreign carmakers like Hyundai will be at a significant disadvantage because of restrictions aimed at cutting China out of the supply chain.

headline.main: U.S. Car Brands Will Benefit Most From Electric Car Tax Breaks
headline.print_headline: U.S. Brands Gain Edge With Tax Breaks for E.V.s

docs.abstract: Domestic companies are now selling more vehicles than their multinational rivals, which have failed to keep up with Chinese consumers’ demand for electric cars and S.U.V.s.
docs.snippet: Domestic companies are now selling more vehicles than their multinational rivals, which have failed to keep up with Chinese consumers’ demand for electric cars and S.U.V.s.
docs.lead_paragraph: For years, foreign automakers in China had a bead on customers drawn to luxury brands, like the Cao family in Shanghai. Not anymore.

headline.main: China’s Car Buyers Have Fallen Out of Love With Foreign Brands
headline.print_headline: If It’s Domestic and Electric, China’s Car Buyers Want to Own It

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks

docs.abstract: Here is what car buyers need to know about the Biden administration’s proposal to push the auto industry to sell more electric cars.
docs.snippet: Here is what car buyers need to know about the Biden administration’s proposal to push the auto industry to sell more electric cars.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration on Wednesday proposed ambitious auto emissions rules that could significantly change the kinds of cars and trucks on sale in the United States — but not right away.

headline.main: Confused About Electric Cars? We Have Some Answers.

docs.abstract: New federal rules are expected to speed the transition to E.V.s, a shift that car companies have embraced but will be challenged to carry out.
docs.snippet: New federal rules are expected to speed the transition to E.V.s, a shift that car companies have embraced but will be challenged to carry out.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration’s plan to accelerate the adoption of electric vehicles — reaching a two-thirds share of new cars in less than a decade — pushes automakers further in a direction they have already been going. But meeting the new timetable will be a challenge.

headline.main: Automakers Face Test in Reaching U.S. Target for Electric Vehicles
headline.print_headline: A Test for Automakers: Meeting Biden’s Deadline

docs.abstract: As luxury cars become rolling supercomputers, designers are wondering how big is too big.
docs.snippet: As luxury cars become rolling supercomputers, designers are wondering how big is too big.
docs.lead_paragraph: From pocket-stretching smartphones to wall-hogging TVs, Americans have often asked: How much screen is too much?

headline.main: Cool? Or Just Clunky? The Fight Over Dashboard Touch Screens.
headline.print_headline: Is That a TV on the Dashboard?

docs.abstract: A former firefighter, he broke the land-speed record repeatedly in the 1960s in jet-engine-powered vehicles, all called Spirit of America.
docs.snippet: A former firefighter, he broke the land-speed record repeatedly in the 1960s in jet-engine-powered vehicles, all called Spirit of America.
docs.lead_paragraph: Craig Breedlove, the first person to set land-speed records at 400, 500 and 600 miles per hour, died on Tuesday at his home in Rio Vista, Calif. He was 86.

headline.main: Craig Breedlove, 86, Once the Fastest Man on Earth, Dies
headline.print_headline: Craig Breedlove, Racer  Who Was Fastest Man On Earth, Dies at 86

docs.abstract: The state, heavily dependent on the auto industry, is a case study in whether electric vehicles will create or destroy jobs.
docs.snippet: The state, heavily dependent on the auto industry, is a case study in whether electric vehicles will create or destroy jobs.
docs.lead_paragraph: Erick Belmer has seen how tough the car business can be. He was working at a General Motors plant in Lordstown, Ohio, when it shut down in 2019, devastating the community.

headline.main: In Ohio, Electric Cars Are Starting to Reshape Jobs and Companies
headline.print_headline: Ohio Races to Retool for Electric Car Revolution

byline.original: By Jack Ewing and Maddie McGarvey

docs.abstract: A former Tesla factory worker, who is Black, challenged a judge’s earlier award of $15 million, but came away with less in a new trial.
docs.snippet: A former Tesla factory worker, who is Black, challenged a judge’s earlier award of $15 million, but came away with less in a new trial.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal jury in San Francisco ordered Tesla on Monday to pay about $3.2 million to a Black man who had accused the carmaker of ignoring racial abuse he faced while working at its California factory.

headline.main: Jury Says Tesla Must Pay Worker $3.2 Million Over Racist Treatment
headline.print_headline: Tesla to Pay Worker $3.2 Million for Racist Treatment
